nodes.bodyText:
I think we should avoid having a global counter here.

It would be global across all tables,
It would cause race conditions because each node would have its own independent counter. So CREATE TABLE´ on node1 would create the same number as CREATE TABLE` on node2.

I think we should keep the AST close to the statement and omit the name if it wasn't specified by the user.
This can be generated later on in the execution layer when we store the meta data.
Is implements ToXContent necessary?

Please no setters on AST structures.
We cache those for prepared statements, so we should make sure that they're immutable.

commit.message:
Add CHECK constraint syntax to create table statement

The CHECK constraint specifies that the value/s of certain column/s
must satisfy a boolean expression on insert and update.

Syntax:

  check(boolean_expression)
  constraint <name> check(boolean_expression)

With two options:

 - As many check constraints as required, as additional elements of
   a create table statement.
   When name is omitted, one is generated with pattern fqtn_check_uuid,
   where:

     fqtb: full qualified table name.
     check: check.
     uuid: 6 random hexadecimal digits (2 octets)
           e.g. doc_my_table_check_bd3f57640937.

 - A single check constraint is allowed as part of a column definition.
   When name is omitted, the pattern is fqtn_column_check_uuid,
   where:

     column: column name.
